meanings.definition: An electronic machine used for storing information.
examples: My computer helps me keep track of all my work.

images.alt: Photo of a teacher and students in a classroom.
images.description: Students sitting at a table, working on computers. A teacher helps one student.
images.caption: People use computers in and out of school.

meanings.definition: A kind of science that focuses on what kinds of substances things are made of.
examples: Chemistry shows that water is made of hydrogen and oxygen.

images.alt: Photo of person holding a flask containing a blue liquid.
images.description: A person wears a white lab coat and blue gloves. The person holds a flask. The flask has a blue liquid in it.
images.caption: Teenagers looking at a smartphone.

meanings.definition: Organized sounds made by voice or instruments.
examples: The singers practiced together and made beautiful music.

meanings.definition: The study of numbers, quantity, and space.
examples: The math I learned helped me figure out how much material I needed for a project.

images.alt: Photo of a person writing on a whiteboard.
images.description: A person writing numbers on a white board.
images.caption: People use computers in and out of school.

meanings.definition: A living thing with sensory organs that can react quickly to external actions.
examples: The frightened animals gathered closely together when they heard the loud noise.

images.description: Two penguins standing on rocks. Rocks, snow, and ice can be seen in the distance.
images.caption: Penguins are animals that live in Antarctica.

source.title: Selective Focus Photography of Two Penguins
source.author: DSD
